result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:02 PM Defendant Cole David John GOERTZ appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney John A Birdsall appeared by video for Cole David John GOERTZ.  Attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that grounds exist for joinder of 20CF323, 22CF35, and 22CF92.
The court finds that it is not proper to join 22CF228 and denies joining it.
The court takes the position that the defendant will not be substantially prejudiced by joinder of 20CF323, 22CF35 and 22CF92.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Scheduling conference on November 30, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant in custody.    
State filed a motion for joinder of cases on 20 CF 323, 22 CF 35, 22 CF 92 and 22 CF 228.  Defense objects.   Court will issue an oral decision on 09-07-22 at 1:00 p.m.    
Minutes.
Status conference on August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:40 PM  Defendant Cole David John Goertz appeared by video, in custody, Attorney John A Birdsall appeared by video for Cole David John Goertz, Attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Court finds that the Defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily agrees to appearing via ZOOM for today's hearing.  State calls its first witness, Detective Brett Oswald of the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department.  State begins its examination.  Defense objects at 2:43 PM.  Court overrules objection.  Defense objects at 2:51 PM  Court overrules objection.  Defense objects at 2:54 PM  Question is rephased.  State has no further questions 2:56 PM  Defense begins cross examination at 2:57 PM  Defense rests at 3:04 PM  State has no further questions.  Witness is dismissed.  Court finds that probable cause exists and binds the Defendant over for further proceedings.  
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information to be filed with original charges from the criminal complaint.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:  April 1, 2022.
Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on April 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

1:55 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Cole David John Goertz appeared by video, in custody, Attorney John A Birdsall appeared by video for Cole David John Goertz. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 cash with the condition that he have no contact with anyone under the age of 18.   Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance on February 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
